CatDescriptText: Charles Green, 810 River Avenue, Coraopolis was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 14, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the City of Pittsburgh should own and operate its transportation system (street cars and buses)?" answer reads: "I really do, because all the other cities, like Cleveland for instance, have city-owned transportation systems and this results in better service. From experience, I know that trying to get to a ball game is rough indeed."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Green wearing hat, moustache, plaid scarf, translucent raincoat, and light colored knit gloves, standing in front of marble pillar with men and women walking on the right, and storefront windows on the left
